lead_paragraph: Television begins to pull itself out of the repeat doldrums this weekend, with a few new series and new episodes turning up amid the sporting events. MSNBC, after an all-day marathon of "Lockup" repeats, offers the premiere of a prison reality show with a twist: "The Squeeze," at 10 p.m., follows the Cook County Sheriff's Criminal Intelligence Unit as it tries to squeeze information out of Chicago inmates. The assessment of chicagonow.com: "The C.I.U. agents viewers meet are all about their work, not promoting themselves -- a refreshing change from other shows of this kind."

headline.main: What to Watch This Weekend: Cops, Dogs and Dr. Who
